Thanks for the clarification Gordon.  With your response I was able to sort=
 out the function with my developer allowing custom inputs via the console =
without having to open up the .java file and recompiling each time a custom=
 parameter is changed.

David

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gord=
on Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> Your screenshot shows a component called 'A=
bstractExtractor'. That's not 
> a part of the official H1 distribution.
> =

> Most H1 components *do* allow settings changes even during a running 
> =
crawl via the web console, when such settings make sense to vary after 
> l=
aunch. (This is one thing that's a bit easier in H1 than H3, though for 
> =
the settings that make sense to change mid-crawl, they can still be 
> foun=
d and changes via the 'Bean Browse' or 'Script Console' functions.)
> 
> An=
y component, even this 'AbstractExtractor', that shows its settings in 
> t=
hat web form should respect settings changes that are made *before* a 
> cr=
awl is launched. (The setting ought not even appear there otherwise.)
> 
> =
You'll need to ask the author(s) of the AbstractExtractor why things 
> are=
n't behaving as you expect.
> 
> - Gordon
> 
> On 8/8/12 1:05 PM, David P. =
Gross wrote:

ow]

are asking (if I am

8080 which is the

eing able to change extractor fields inside the console is standard

itrix function by virtue of the extractor being selected as a

processor in the module tab.

 I can change Heritrix

m extractor specific

 functional without

he .java file and

that since I can copy/paste URL seeds directly into the

d also change the other fields presented to me as well.

 nice to change the fields on the fly inside Heritrix rather

 into the .java file for each run requiring new keyword or

tials( what I do now).  I realize I'll have to pay for that

m keyword/mysql projects.
